intro: Strobilanthes scoriarum, commonly known as the Christmas or Christmas flower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, bright yellow flowers that bloom profusely during the Christmas season, hence its common name. The plant is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Strobilanthes scoriarum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is popular in horticulture due to its vibrant blooms.
